s.label: Observation settings
s.desc: These parameters are used to specify the observation.

s.label: Phase centre RA [deg]
s.desc: Right Ascension of the observation pointing (phase centre), in degrees.

s.label: Phase centre Dec [deg]
s.desc: Declination of the observation pointing (phase centre), in degrees.

s.label: Station pointing file
s.desc: Pathname to optional station pointing file, which can be used to override the beam direction for any or all stations in the telescope model. See the accompanying documentation for a description of a station pointing file.

s.label: Start frequency [Hz]
s.desc: The frequency at the midpoint of the first channel, in Hz.

s.label: Number of frequency channels
s.desc: Number of frequency channels / bands to use.

s.label: Frequency increment [Hz]
s.desc: The frequency increment between successive channels, in Hz.

s.label: Start time (UTC)
s.desc:
The start time and date for the observation. This can either be a MJD value or a string with one of the following formats:
d-M-yyyy h:m:s.z
yyyy/M/d/h:m:s.z
yyyy-M-d h:m:s.z
yyyy-M-dTh:m:s.z
where:
d is the day number (1 to 31)
M is the month (1 to 12)
yyyy is the year (4 digits)
h is the hour (0 to 23)
m is minutes (0 to 59)
s is seconds (0 to 59)
z is milliseconds (0 to 999)
Note that date and time values support optional leading zeros in the format string.

s.label: Observation length [sec, or hh:mm:ss]
s.desc:
The observation length either in seconds, or in hours, minutes and seconds as a formatted string with the syntax h:m:s.z. where:
h is the hour (0 to 23)
m is minutes (0 to 59)
s is seconds (0 to 59)
z is milliseconds (0 to 999)
Note that values support optional leading zeros in the format string.

s.label: Number of time steps
s.desc: Number of time steps in the output data during the observation length. This corresponds to the number of correlator dumps for interferometer simulations, and the number of beam pattern snapshots for beam pattern simulations.
